content.body: How would I construct a Map from a Spec List without any observable behaviors?
hm, actually that's a lot of hoops
I would have to convert my `List<List<*>>` into `Array<[key, value]>`, first
content.formatted_body: I would have to convert my List<List<*>> into Array<[key, value]>, first

content.body: Can I just construct a object with `[[MapData]]`?
content.formatted_body: Can I just construct a object with [[MapData]]?

content.body: iow, iterate over the list, and just mutate the Map entries of the Map you created

> Can I just construct a object with `[[MapData]]`?

You can but for clarity I would call `%Map%` and then mutate its internal slots
content.formatted_body:
Can I just construct a object with [[MapData]]?

You can but for clarity I would call %Map% and then mutate its internal slots

content.body: I like having `Map` be the sole thing which creates an object with a `[[MapData]]`
content.formatted_body: I like having Map be the sole thing which creates an object with a [[MapData]]

content.body: That's pretty much what structured deserializing does for Map objects, although we don't construct the objects properly; I guess shu gets to fix that 😛
content.formatted_body: That's pretty much what structured deserializing does for Map objects, although we don't construct the objects properly; I guess shu gets to fix that 😛
